Situation1: They notice a few pool chairs are slightly misaligned but still usable.
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They notice someone in their circle going through difficulties and respond with care
Story: As I walked along the pool deck, the sun glinting off the water, I noticed a few of the pool chairs were out of line. As a lifeguard, I knew I was expected to keep everything in order, to maintain the equipment and facilities so everyone could enjoy a safe, pleasant environment. I started to move toward the chairs, but then I caught sight of Sarah, one of the regulars, sitting alone at the edge of the pool. Her shoulders were hunched, and she looked like she was fighting back tears. As a Christian, I felt a deep pull to go to her, to offer a listening ear and a kind word, just as Jesus would have done. But the expectation to keep the pool area tidy pressed on me, too. I stood there, torn, the weight of both roles heavy on my shoulders, unsure which expectation I should meet first.
